text: June unemployment rates ranged from 4% in Kentucky to 17% in Massachusetts.
Seven states and DC saw leisure and hospitality employment fall over 40% since June 2019.
Hawaii and New York saw the largest declines in GDP from Q1 2019 to Q1 2020.
June state and local public employment reached a 30-year low in Maine and Rhode Island.
In June, average private-sector weekly earnings ranged from $775 in MS to $1,775 in DC.
Since last June, year-over-year private employment declined in all 50 states and DC.
Between May and June, private employment increased in all 50 states and DC.
June unemployment set a 40-year high in Massachusetts, New Jersey, and New York.
Alaska’s state and local public education employment in June was 22% less than a year prior.
DC’s Q1 2020 GDP from accommodation and food services fell 9 percent compared to Q1 2019.
Only AK and WV saw a year-over-year decline in house prices from Q1 2019 to Q1 2020.
Washington’s annual house price growth has exceeded the US average each quarter since 2014.
